docs.title: Indicator Helpers
docs.description: Helper functions are utility tools that work alongside indicators to generate signals and evaluate conditions. Most are real-time with no lag — they simply compare values on the current bar. Use them to build composite trading rules from individual indicator outputs.

docs.title: Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD)
docs.description: Minimum bars needed: longperiod + signalperiod bars

docs.title: Momentum Confluence
docs.description: Minimum bars needed: max(moneyflowlength, trendwavelength) bars

docs.title: Momentum Cycle Sentry
docs.description: The multi-layer EMA smoothing and momentum lookback introduce lag relative to the actual price action.

docs.title: Momentum & Oscillators
docs.description: Momentum indicators measure the speed and strength of price movements. They oscillate between extremes and are particularly useful for identifying overbought/oversold conditions, momentum divergence, and trend exhaustion. All momentum indicators are lagging due to their smoothing calculations, but they excel at confirming the quality of a trend and signaling when it may be losing steam.

docs.title: Stochastic Oscillator (STO)
docs.description: Minimum bars needed: kperiod + kslowing + d_period bars

docs.title: Z-Score Predictive Zones
docs.description: Z-Score smoothing and dynamic reversal levels introduce lag relative to the actual reversal.

docs.title: Pattern Recognition
docs.description: Pattern recognition indicators automatically detect recurring price structures such as peaks, troughs, and divergences. They are real-time but require a confirmation delay of several bars to validate each pattern. Use them for systematic scanning of setups that would be time-consuming to spot manually.

docs.title: Accumulation & Distribution Zones
docs.description: Zone detection is triggered when alternating pivot highs and lows form a converging pattern.

docs.title: Golden Zone Signal
docs.description: Minimum bars needed: Same as Golden Zone (length bars)

docs.title: Liquidity Pools
docs.description: Minimum bars needed: ≥ contactcount × gapbars bars

docs.title: Opening Gap (OG)
docs.description: Opening Gaps are detected on the current bar by comparing it to two bars earlier.

docs.title: Support & Resistance
docs.description: Support and resistance indicators identify key price levels where buying or selling pressure is likely to appear. This category includes both classical techniques (Fibonacci, Golden Zone) and Smart Money Concepts (SMC) / ICT methods (Order Blocks, Liquidity Sweeps, etc.). Most of these are real-time — they react to structural price action rather than smoothing history — though they often have a confirmation delay while waiting for swing points to be validated.

docs.title: Pure Price Action Liquidity Sweeps
docs.description: Minimum bars needed: depth-dependent (varies by fractal depth)

docs.title: Range Intelligence Suite
docs.description: Consolidation detection triggers as soon as rolling range width falls below the ATR-based threshold.

docs.title: Strong / Weak Highs & Lows
docs.description: Strong / Weak classification requires confirmed swing points and trend context.

docs.title: Volume Imbalance (VI)
docs.description: Volume Imbalances are detected on the current bar by comparing it to the previous bar.

docs.title: Volumetric Supply & Demand Zones
docs.description: Zone detection is triggered immediately when a pivot is confirmed with a qualifying impulse move.

docs.title: Trend Indicators
docs.description: Trend indicators help you identify the direction and strength of a market move. They smooth out price noise so you can focus on the underlying trajectory. Because they rely on historical averages, all trend indicators are lagging — they confirm a trend rather than predict it. Use them to align your trades with the dominant direction and to filter out counter-trend noise.

docs.title: Pulse Mean Accelerator (PMA)
docs.description: Minimum bars needed: max(malength, accellookback) bars

docs.title: Volatility Indicators
docs.description: Volatility indicators measure how much price is moving, regardless of direction. They help you size positions, set stop-losses, and identify when markets are unusually quiet (potential breakout) or loud (potential exhaustion). All volatility indicators are lagging because they smooth historical price ranges.

docs.title: Installation
docs.description: PyIndicators can be installed using pip:

docs.title: Introduction
docs.description: PyIndicators is a powerful and user-friendly Python library for financial technical analysis indicators, metrics and helper functions. Written entirely in Python, it requires no external dependencies, ensuring seamless integration and ease of use.
